flawed_nl_solution:
Tom can buy 1000/2=<<1000/2=500>>500 for half price.
He will spend $.0.5/2= $<<0.5/2=0.25>>0.25 on the half-priced bricks.
Thus, he will spend 500*$.0.25=$125<<500*0.25=125>>125 on the half-priced bricks.
He will spend 500*$.0.5=$250<<500*0.5=250>>250 on the full-priced bricks.
Thus, he will spend $125+$250=$372<<125+250=372>>372 total.
#### 372

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 375, not 372. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
